intro: Cyathophora heterophyla, commonly known as the variable cyathophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and small animals. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
